text:
e="preserve">Hou Feng (; 3 February 1928 - 7 November 2020) was a Chinese engineer. He was known for his works in plant breeding. He was known for his disease resistant cucumber, which earned him the nickname "Cucumber King" ().
He was a member of the Chinese Academy of Agricultural Sciences (CAAS) and Chinese Society for Horticultural Science (CSHS).
Hou died of illness in Tianjin, on November 7, 2020 at the age of 92.
